19B. Get physical! Oops... This does not mean throwing punches, give your sex life a boost😀. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @KemiOdutayo
19.According to Psychologists, maintaining a satisfying physical relationship helps couples not to grow apart.#GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
18. Be proactive; growing apart is not imposed on any one, so do not let it happen.#GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @sam_adeyemi @chidi_akunna
17B. Read books together, share ideas, cook together,... Get creative! #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @LekeAlder @pastorpoju @ChinweJaja
17. To avoid growing apart, spice up your marriage; make your marriage more interesting. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @LekeAlder
16. On the other hand, avoid the blame game and see how U can make things better.#GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @chidi_akunna @LanreAgboola1

15B. Seeing things from the other's point of view will help, to a great extent. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @drmikemurdock @pastorpoju
15. Don't get defensive when a wrong is pointed out, listen to the pain being expressed. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @homebuildersng
14B. Issues become bigger when swept under the carpet.#GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @drmikemurdock @24karatslife @chidi_akunna @NikeAdeyemi
14. It may be uncomfortable to talk about hurt and pain, but you have to talk about it. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @drmikemurdock
13. Why do you think you are growing apart? What can you do to boost your relationship?#GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient@jbledsoejr @askdrmalik
12B. Be flexible for the sake of your relationship. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @BridgetElesin @chidi_akunna @24karatslife @LanreAgboola1
12. Be willing to compromise; help out at home, have sex when all you want to do is sleep. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @BridgetElesin
11.The pressure of providing enough for the family may put a strain on the relationship if not handled right. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
10. Through changing times, ensure you remain friends and lovers. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient @homebuildersng @chidi_akunna @sam_adeyemi
9. Couples must learn to manage change, such as pregnancy, childbirth, demands of a new job role, etc. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
8B. ...this can lead to the lack of intimacy and in the long run, cause the couple to grow apart. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
8. When a spouse's expectations are not met, disappointment and hurt could creep in. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
7. A progressive disconnection from your spouse is not a good sign; take practical steps to bridge the gap. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
6. Wanting to spend less time with your spouse/not enjoying his/her company shows your marriage needs a boost.#GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
5. Keeping secrets & making big decisions without consulting your spouse is a sign that you are growing apart.#GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
4. Having busy lives makes it easy for couples to grow apart. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
3. Growing apart does not happen suddenly, it grows slowly. #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
2. One of the common reasons couples give for their divorce is "we grew apart". #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient
1. How do couples go from being Soulmates to Roommates? #GrowingApart #RomanceQuotient

RT @chidi_akunna: 15. Take charge of your emotions - "rejoice in the Lord always!" #MoodSwing #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 14. When people are stressed, the tendency is that they cannot tolerate as much as they ordinarily would. #MoodSwing #iCo…
RT @chidi_akunna: 13. Know your stress threshold and when you are exceeding it, then find time to rest. #MoodSwing #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 12. Also, try to catch enough sleep, it helps you get less irritable. #MoodSwing #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 11. An example is to cut down on your consumption of caffeine which can affect your mood. #MoodSwing #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 10. Medical experts would advise that you eat well; eat the right things and know what to avoid. #MoodSwing #iConnectHear…
RT @chidi_akunna: 8. If allowed, mood swing can spiral out of control; from resentment to anger to depression... #MoodSwing #iConnectHearts

RT @chidi_akunna: 5. It could be minor or major & could occur in women with premenstrual syndrome, hormonal changes or menopause. #MoodSwin…
RT @chidi_akunna: 4. According to medical author, Melissa Conrad Stoppler, "mood swing refers to the rapid change in mood". #MoodSwing #iCo…
RT @chidi_akunna: 3. One may expect "dad" to do his best to understand "mum", but the focus today is on mum who has mood swings. #MoodSwing…
RT @chidi_akunna: 2. "...Sometimes, dad looks lost, after 14yrs, he still doesn't understand why her mood changes abruptly." - B.D. #MoodSw…

24. We hope you would take action immediately to move your marriage from a good to a great marriage. #DatingMySpouse @chidi_akunna
23. Ensure that you agree on a unified vision. #DatingMySpouse
22. Choose one to two items you would like to address, choosing too many may become overwhelming. #DatingMySpouse
21. Tip 3 - You can go for a retreat; a few days by yourselves in a retreat venue. #DatingMySpouse
20. Tip 2 - You can choose an affordable restaurant or a simple free location where you can have some privacy to talk. #DatingMySpouse

19. I will share some tips.
Tip 1- You can choose a day to just lie in with a movie, just for you both. #DatingMySpouse
18. Come up with creative ideas on how to date your spouse. #DatingMySpouse
17. After being married for a while, you should know what appeals to your spouse. #DatingMySpouse
16. Let it be so memorable that you both look forward to the next one. #DatingMySpouse
15. Come up with a plan, do your best to make it fun and memorable. That implies considering what you both would enjoy. #DatingMySpouse
14. Just start, it doesn't have to be perfect, break out of the inertia and choose a location. #DatingMySpouse
13. Don't postpone it, start today. Pick up your calendar, choose a convenient day with your spouse and do it. #DatingMySpouse
12. The opposite of spicy romance is a draining and crisis-ridden marriage. #DatingMySpouse
11. Are you leveraging on dating to spice up your marital romance? #DatingMySpouse
10. Are you taking advantage of the benefits of dating to bridge the gap between you and your spouse? #DatingMySpouse
9. Are you proactive about your marriage? Are you deliberate? #DatingMySpouse
